page.title: 01A Description of our area.
page.content: Our area is fairly flat, the highest point is about 40 metres above sea level. The land is mostly used for crops with some pasture. Most of the area south of the River Welland is parkland belonging to Burghley Estate. North of the river belonged to the Barclay Harvey family who lived at Uffington house, but it is now let or owned by local farmers who live in or near Uffington, a village of about 400 people. The main features are Burghley House and Uffington Church. The older stone built houses have slate roofs. There is also a small modern housing estate.The main A16road goes east/west through the village carrying quite heavy traffic. The Peterborough / Leicester railway line also runs east/ west along_side the River Welland. Tall metal pylons have been erected over many fields to carry electricity.
